revised_title: Observations on Air Composition in Pneumatothorax and Pleura Absorption Experiments
tldr: John Davy investigates the composition of air found in the pleura in a pneumatothorax case and conducts experiments on the absorption of different gases in the pleura. He concludes that the pleura can absorb one kind of gas more than another and suggests that the appearance of air in the pleura is due to secretion.
